abstract: How did Facebook end up worth more, theoretically, than one of the world’s largest media conglomerates?
snippet: How did Facebook end up worth more, theoretically, than one of the world’s largest media conglomerates?
lead_paragraph: Word arrived Monday that Facebook, the burgeoning social media company that surpassed Google last year as the most visited Web site, was worth $50 billion based on a deal done by Goldman Sachs. By way of comparison, our colleagues Andrew Ross Sorkin and Evelyn M. Rusli pointed out that the company was worth more than Time Warner, the large United States media company, which closed the day with a market cap of about $37 billion.

headline.main: Facebook vs. Time Warner: A Not-So-Rigorous Financial Evaluation
